alert.title: Cold Weather Alert
alert.message: The daytime temperature is between 0°C and 10°C. It's quite cold outside. Please dress warmly and avoid exposure to the cold for extended periods.
actions: Wear layers of clothing
Stay indoors if possible
Use heating devices safely

tips: Keep your home heated to a comfortable level.
Avoid prolonged exposure to cold weather.
Check on vulnerable individuals, such as the elderly and children.
Wear insulated and waterproof footwear.
precautions: Ensure that you have sufficient fuel for heating.
Be aware of the risk of hypothermia and frostbite.
Avoid alcohol as it can lower body temperature.

health_impacts: Risk of hypothermia and frostbite.
Increased risk of respiratory issues due to cold air.
Potential for aggravating pre-existing conditions like arthritis.
Reduced immune function leading to increased susceptibility to illness.

alert.title: Freezing Night Alert
alert.message: The night-time temperature is between 0°C and 10°C. Be aware of potential freezing conditions. Ensure your home is properly heated and avoid going out in the cold.
actions: Keep your home heated to a comfortable level.
Check for drafts and seal windows and doors.
Wear warm clothing, even indoors.

tips: Ensure your home is well insulated.
Use space heaters safely if necessary.
Monitor vulnerable individuals, especially at night.
Keep extra blankets and warm clothing accessible.
precautions: Check the functionality of your heating system.
Be cautious of potential carbon monoxide from heating devices.
Have a backup heating plan in case of power outages.

health_impacts: Increased risk of hypothermia during the night.
Possible disruption of sleep due to cold temperatures.
Higher risk of cold-related illnesses if sleeping in unheated environments.
Possible increase in joint pain or stiffness.

alert.title: Cool Weather Alert
alert.message: The daytime temperature is between 11°C and 20°C. It's cool outside. You may need a light jacket or sweater.
actions: Dress in layers
Prepare for potential temperature changes
Enjoy outdoor activities while dressed appropriately

tips: Layer your clothing to adjust easily to changing temperatures.
Stay hydrated.
Be mindful of the weather forecast for any sudden changes.
Avoid prolonged exposure to cool or windy conditions.
precautions: Avoid sudden exposure to very cold or hot environments.
Monitor weather updates regularly.
Prepare for unexpected weather changes.

health_impacts: Mild risk of respiratory discomfort if exposed for long periods.
Potential for mild cold-related illnesses if not dressed appropriately.
Can affect those with sensitive respiratory systems or chronic conditions.
Minor risk of exacerbating joint pain or stiffness in colder weather.

alert.title: Cool Night Alert
alert.message: The night-time temperature is between 11°C and 20°C. The temperature may feel chilly. Dress warmly if needed and ensure your sleeping environment is comfortable.
actions: Use extra blankets or a fan if needed.
Keep windows closed at night to maintain warmth.
Consider a light sweater or thermal wear if needed.

tips: Use additional bedding to stay warm at night.
Ensure that your bedroom is comfortably warm.
Check weather conditions before going to bed.
Avoid heavy meals before sleeping to prevent discomfort.
precautions: Keep an eye on indoor temperatures.
Be prepared for any sudden temperature drops.
Have extra warm clothing and bedding available.

health_impacts: Potential for mild cold-related discomfort during the night.
Risk of disrupted sleep due to temperature fluctuations.
May affect those with respiratory or cardiovascular conditions.
Possible minor dehydration if fluid intake is insufficient.

alert.title: Moderate Temperature Alert
alert.message: The daytime temperature is between 21°C and 29°C. The weather is mild. Enjoy your day but be prepared for any weather changes.
actions: Wear comfortable clothing
Stay hydrated
Keep an eye on the weather forecast

tips: Maintain a balanced routine of outdoor and indoor activities.
Stay hydrated and protect yourself from the sun.
Monitor the weather for any upcoming changes.
Use sunscreen and wear sunglasses if outdoors.
precautions: Be aware of any upcoming weather changes.
Prepare for potential fluctuations in temperature.
Keep track of UV index levels to avoid overexposure to sunlight.

health_impacts: Generally low risk, but be mindful of individual health conditions.
Mild risk of heat-related issues if exposed to direct sunlight for extended periods.
Can affect those with cardiovascular or respiratory conditions.
Minor risk of dehydration if fluid intake is not adequate.

alert.title: Mild Night Alert
alert.message: The night-time temperature is between 21°C and 29°C. The temperature should be comfortable, but keep an eye on the forecast for any changes.
actions: Use light bedding or a fan if needed.
Ensure your sleeping environment is well-ventilated.
Monitor weather changes that might affect your sleep.

tips: Use light bedding and ventilation to stay comfortable.
Monitor indoor temperatures to avoid overheating.
Be prepared for any changes in temperature.
Avoid heavy meals before sleeping to prevent discomfort.
precautions: Adjust bedding as needed for comfort.
Consider using a fan or keeping windows open for airflow.
Keep an eye on temperature changes and adjust accordingly.

health_impacts: Generally comfortable, but can cause minor discomfort if temperatures are not regulated.
Risk of disrupted sleep if the temperature fluctuates significantly.
May affect those with heat sensitivity or respiratory issues.
Possible minor dehydration if fluid intake is insufficient.

alert.title: High Temperature Alert
alert.message: The daytime temperature is between 30°C and 35°C. It's quite hot outside. Be cautious of heat-related issues and stay hydrated.
actions: Avoid strenuous activities during peak heat hours.
Stay in air-conditioned or shaded areas.
Drink plenty of water and avoid alcohol.

tips: Stay in cool, shaded environments as much as possible.
Wear light, breathable clothing.
Keep hydrated and avoid caffeine and alcohol.
Use sunscreen and wear a hat when outdoors.
precautions: Monitor for signs of heat exhaustion and heat stroke.
Be mindful of the UV index and take appropriate precautions.
Adjust indoor temperatures with fans or air conditioning.

health_impacts: Increased risk of heat exhaustion and heat stroke.
Possible dehydration if fluid intake is insufficient.
Potential aggravation of cardiovascular conditions.
Higher risk of sunburn and related issues if outdoors.

alert.title: Warm Night Alert
alert.message: The night-time temperature is between 30°C and 35°C. The night may be warm. Ensure good ventilation and stay hydrated.
actions: Use fans or air conditioning to cool the room.
Wear lightweight sleepwear.
Keep hydrated and avoid heavy meals before bed.

tips: Use fans or air conditioning to maintain a comfortable temperature.
Keep windows open for airflow if safe to do so.
Wear light and breathable sleepwear.
Drink water before bed and avoid caffeine and alcohol.
precautions: Monitor for signs of heat-related illnesses.
Ensure proper ventilation to avoid overheating.
Be prepared for potential fluctuations in temperature.

health_impacts: Risk of sleep discomfort due to high temperatures.
Increased risk of dehydration and heat-related illnesses.
Potential aggravation of respiratory conditions.
Minor risk of overheating if proper precautions are not taken.

alert.title: Extreme Heat Alert
alert.message: The daytime temperature is between 36°C and 40°C. It's extremely hot. Limit outdoor activities and take measures to stay cool.
actions: Avoid going outside during peak heat hours.
Stay in air-conditioned environments.
Drink water frequently and avoid dehydration.

tips: Stay indoors as much as possible during peak heat.
Use air conditioning or fans to stay cool.
Wear light, loose-fitting clothing.
Hydrate regularly and avoid alcohol and caffeine.
precautions: Watch for signs of heat stroke or heat exhaustion.
Ensure good ventilation indoors.
Avoid strenuous activities and rest frequently.

health_impacts: High risk of heat exhaustion and heat stroke.
Significant risk of dehydration.
Potential for heat-related illnesses affecting cardiovascular and respiratory health.
Increased risk of heat-induced complications.

alert.title: Very Warm Night Alert
alert.message: The night-time temperature is between 36°C and 40°C. Expect a very warm night. Ensure proper ventilation and stay hydrated.
actions: Use fans or air conditioning to maintain a cool environment.
Wear light sleepwear and keep hydrated.
Avoid heavy meals and drink plenty of water.

tips: Use air conditioning or fans to cool down.
Keep windows open for airflow if possible.
Stay hydrated and avoid caffeine and alcohol.
Wear lightweight and breathable sleepwear.
precautions: Be vigilant for signs of overheating.
Ensure your environment remains cool and well-ventilated.
Prepare for any sudden temperature changes.

health_impacts: Risk of significant sleep discomfort due to high temperatures.
High risk of dehydration and heat-related health issues.
Increased risk of heat stroke and heat exhaustion.
Potential exacerbation of pre-existing health conditions.

alert.title: Severe Heat Alert
alert.message: The daytime temperature is between 41°C and 50°C. Extreme caution is required. Limit exposure to the heat and take all necessary precautions to stay safe.
actions: Avoid outdoor activities as much as possible.
Stay in a cool, air-conditioned environment.
Drink water frequently and avoid dehydration.
Check on vulnerable individuals, including the elderly and young children.

tips: Stay indoors with air conditioning or fans running.
Wear light, breathable clothing and use a hat or umbrella for protection.
Stay hydrated with water or electrolyte solutions.
Monitor for signs of heat exhaustion or heat stroke.
precautions: Ensure proper ventilation indoors.
Avoid alcohol and caffeine, which can increase dehydration.
Have a plan in place for potential power outages or cooling system failures.

health_impacts: Very high risk of heat exhaustion and heat stroke.
Severe dehydration if fluid intake is inadequate.
Increased risk of serious heat-related health issues, including cardiovascular and respiratory conditions.
Potential for heat-induced complications and exacerbation of existing health issues.

alert.title: Extremely Warm Night Alert
alert.message: The night-time temperature is between 41°C and 50°C. The night will be extremely warm. Ensure you have access to a cool environment and stay hydrated.
actions: Use air conditioning or fans to keep the room cool.
Wear light and breathable sleepwear.
Stay hydrated and avoid heavy meals before bed.

tips: Stay in an air-conditioned room or use a fan.
Wear lightweight, breathable clothing to sleep.
Keep hydrated and avoid caffeine and alcohol.
Ensure proper ventilation to prevent overheating.
precautions: Be vigilant for signs of heat-related illnesses.
Have a backup cooling plan in case of power failures.
Prepare for any sudden temperature fluctuations.

health_impacts: Extreme risk of heat-related health issues, including heat exhaustion and heat stroke.
High risk of dehydration and severe health complications.
Potential exacerbation of pre-existing health conditions.
Severe discomfort and potential risk of overheating during sleep.

alert.title: Extreme Heat Emergency Alert
alert.message: The daytime temperature is 51°C and above. This is an extreme heat emergency. Take all possible measures to protect yourself and limit exposure to the heat.
actions: Avoid going outside unless absolutely necessary.
Stay in a well-ventilated, air-conditioned environment.
Drink water continuously and avoid dehydration.
Check on vulnerable individuals regularly and ensure they are safe.

tips: Remain indoors in a cool, air-conditioned space.
Wear minimal clothing and use cool compresses if necessary.
Stay hydrated with water and electrolyte solutions.
Monitor for signs of heat exhaustion or heat stroke and seek medical attention if needed.
precautions: Ensure you have access to emergency cooling methods.
Be prepared for potential power outages or cooling system failures.
Avoid alcohol and caffeine to reduce dehydration risk.

health_impacts: Extreme risk of heat stroke, heat exhaustion, and severe dehydration.
High risk of serious health complications affecting cardiovascular and respiratory systems.
Potential for life-threatening conditions if appropriate measures are not taken.
Significant discomfort and risk of heat-induced complications.

alert.title: Extreme Warm Night Emergency Alert
alert.message: The night-time temperature is 51°C and above. This is an extreme heat emergency during the night. Ensure you have access to cooling and stay hydrated.
actions: Use air conditioning or fans to keep the room as cool as possible.
Wear light and minimal sleepwear.
Stay hydrated and monitor for any signs of heat-related health issues.

tips: Stay in a well-ventilated, air-conditioned environment.
Use cool compresses or take a cool bath if needed.
Wear minimal clothing and ensure hydration.
Be vigilant for signs of heat-related illnesses and seek medical attention if needed.
precautions: Have a backup plan for cooling in case of power outages.
Monitor indoor temperatures and adjust cooling methods as necessary.
Be prepared for potential health emergencies.

health_impacts: Extreme risk of severe health issues due to high nighttime temperatures.
High risk of dehydration and heat-related complications.
Increased potential for heat stroke and other heat-induced conditions.
Severe discomfort and potential life-threatening risks.
